item.title: Ahold Delhaize confirms data theft after INC ransomware claims attack
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Food retail giant Ahold Delhaize confirms that data was stolen from its U.S. business systems during a November 2024 cyberattack. [...]

item.title: CTM360 Tracks Global Surge in SMS-Based Reward and Toll Scams
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by CTM360
item.description: Thousands tricked by fake reward & toll scam texts. CTM360 exposes PointyPhish & TollShark—SMS phishing campaigns powered by the Darcula PhaaS platform, with 5K+ domains stealing payment info worldwide. [...]

item.title: Microsoft: Office 2016 and Office 2019 reach end of support in October
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​​Microsoft has reminded customers that Office 2016 and Office 2019 will reach the end of extended support six months from now, on October 14, 2025. [...]

item.title: CISA warns of increased breach risks following Oracle Cloud leak
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: On Wednesday, CISA warned of heightened breach risks after the compromise of legacy Oracle Cloud servers earlier this year and highlighted the significant threat to enterprise networks. [...]

item.title: New Windows Server emergency updates fix container launch issue
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has released emergency Windows Server updates to address a known issue preventing Windows containers from launching. [...]

item.title: CISA tags SonicWall VPN flaw as actively exploited in attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: On Wednesday, CISA warned federal agencies to secure their SonicWall Secure Mobile Access (SMA) 100 series appliances against attacks exploiting a high-severity remote code execution vulnerability. [...]

item.title: Over 16,000 Fortinet devices compromised with symlink backdoor
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Over 16,000 internet-exposed Fortinet devices have been detected as compromised with a new symlink backdoor that allows read-only access to sensitive files on previously compromised devices. [...]

item.title: Google blocked over 5 billion ads in 2024 amid rise in AI-powered scams
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Google blocked 5.1 billion ads and suspended more than 39.2 million advertiser accounts in 2024, according to its 2024 Ads Safety Report released this week. [...]

item.title: Apple fixes two zero-days exploited in targeted iPhone attacks
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Apple released emergency security updates to patch two zero-day vulnerabilities that were used in an "extremely sophisticated attack" against specific targets' iPhones. [...]

item.title: Google begins unifying search country domains to Google.com
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Google has announced that it's retiring separate country code top-level domain names like google.co.uk or google.com.br and redirecting users to Google.com. [...]

item.title: Jira Down: Atlassian users experiencing degraded performance
item.dc:creator: Ax Sharma
item.description: Atlassian users are experiencing degraded performance amid an 'active incident' affecting multiple Jira products since morning hours today. Jira, Jira Service Management, Jira Work Management and Jira Product Discovery are among the impacted products. [...]

item.title: 41% of Attacks Bypass Defenses: Adversarial Exposure Validation Fixes That
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Picus Security
item.description: Your dashboards say you're secure—but 41% of threats still get through. Picus Security's Adversarial Exposure Validation uncovers what your stack is missing with continuous attack simulations and automated pentesting. [...]

item.title: CISA extends funding to ensure 'no lapse in critical CVE services'
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: CISA says the U.S. government has extended MITRE's funding to ensure no continuity issues with the critical Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) program. [...]
